channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Fridge freezer dumped in front garden of unoccupied house. Been there for at least 3 weeks, 30th November
item.description:
This fridge freezer has been abandoned in the front garden of a house in Windyridge Road, Wymans Brook. This is between Thomond Close and the CoOP.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 14 Windyridge Gardens, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: At least 2 drains have sank, 30th November
item.description:
At least 2 drains on this new road have sank causing quite a bump in the road if you drive over one of them.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 19 Arlington Road, Brockworth
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Parking dangerously on double yellow lines, 29th November
item.description:
Another day, another illegally parked vehicle on double yellow lines, blocking sight for cars turning into and out of Oakland St.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 23 Cudnall Street, Charlton Kings
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 3 Sharp edged Potholes along Cleeve Common Road, 29th November
item.description:
The marker is set to the last pothole of the 3, on the Cleeve Common Road going to the common. There are 2 more of concern on the way to this last one. All three are almost unavoidable as the road is single track and either near side or offside tyres will tend to hit them. While these are the main 3, there are several developing at the edge of this road where vehicles have had to go over the sides. Please can they be fixed as soon as possible.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Cleeve Common, Whittington
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flytip at the Location, 29th November
item.description:
The location is the Cleeve Common Road going towards the common about 0.5 miles from the crossroads at the top of this first hill on the right hand side where the wood being logged out has a gate and layby. The material is mainly plastic - please can it be collected before it attracts more.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): The Dingle, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Road surface broken, 29th November
item.description:
Needs Tarmac
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 3 Pitman Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Road needs cleaning regularly kerbside entrance to road, 29th November
item.description:
Guinevere road need sweeping
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 39 Tennyson Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Numerous potholes along the length of Hoo Lane again., 28th November
item.description:
The whole road is a patchwork of holes and patched holes, it is a nightmare. There are four farms, a caravan park and stable yard on this road so it gets a lot of heavy traffic even in lockdown. It really needs properly resurfacing, not just patching every couple of months.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Orchard Cottage Hoo Lane, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dumped mattress, bed frame and smashed fluorescent tubes, 28th November
item.description:
Mattress, bed frame and fluorescent light bulbs have been dumped in the alley, at the Larput Place end, since as at least Thursday 26th November
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 20 Hungerford Street, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overflowing dog bin by green space, 27th November
item.description:
Dog bin requires emptying. Dog waste being stacked on top. Just outside the fenced triangle of grass next to the Golden Valley Bridge (farm side)
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Burnfield Pirton Lane, Churchdown
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Trench at Edge of road, 27th November
item.description:
Edge of road has been squashed by heavy vehicles leaving a trench deep enough to cause Loss of control if a vehicle strays to the edge of the road. Accident yesterday (28/Nov) at this location where sparks were seen under a van which then span out of control and collided with other vehicles.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): A436, Andoversford
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Junction line markings needed, 27th November
item.description:
Junction of Glencairn Court with Glencairn Park Road. No markings at all as existing. Exiting Glencairn Court onto Glencairn Park Road is a blind left turn, so some junction line markings would help to slow traffic down.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Glencairn Court, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Light not working, 26th November
item.description:
The street light opposite 40 Merlin Way is not working
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 12 Merlin Way, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Drain outside of 43 Wyman's Lane opposite Swindon village park, 26th November
item.description:
This drain has been blocked for over two years

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 41 Wyman's Lane, Swindon Village

item.title: Loose manhole cover, 26th November
item.description:
There is a large, double, square manhole cover which has possibly been dislodged and is making a loud clatter every time a vehicle hits it, the noise is very disturbing and is getting worse. Eventually it will crack and cause a real disruption.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Forge House Church Road, Churchdown
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:
Flytipping
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Brockworth Bypass, Brockworth

item.title: Dangerous broken paving slab, 24th November
item.description:
Outside 11 Bisley Road, Benhall. Broken slab that many people have tripped over, as it sticks up & is wobbly. It’s only a matter of time before somebody is seriously injured
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 17 Bisley Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Lack of road signs, 24th November
item.description:
When the A417 Crickley Hill was blocked due to an accident last week an arcticulated lorry trying to find a way around the blockage drove up Dog Lane and became stuck at three places and needed to be towed by tractor at two locations and at 9:30pm by a recovery vehicle. As a very narrow and winding lane with steep sections Dog Lane would benefit from unsuitable for HGV and unsuitable for long vehicle signs at either end.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Smiths Barn Bentham Lane, Bentham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Street cleaning, 24th November
item.description:
Mud and dead leaves on the lane needs urgent clearing lane becoming dangerous Drivers are complaining and finding access difficult. Please help as this is now an ongoing problem. They could only cut back one side of the hedges etc. This may be due to the difficult conditions. My tel no. 01452 862341. Thank you.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Green Street, Coopers Hill
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree overgrown and will soon bring down phone wires, 23rd November
item.description:
Tree on the corner outside no 7 New Barn Close has been neglected for years and has grown so big it is now tangled in the overhead phone wires. If these wires come down the residents will be without a phone (for how long no-one knows) and some do not have mobiles. BT refuse to do anything and say it is the Council’s responsibility (which it quite rightly is) since the Council own the tree and the land it grows on. The Council did send a work party out recently but all they did was prune a few lower branches.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 7 New Barn Close, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
